text: A Prayer for Protection and Prosperity
A song of ascents. Of Solomon.\f + \fr Ps 127 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
its builders labor at it in vain.
\add It is\add* in vain for you who rise early \add and\add* sit late,
eating the bread of anxious toil,

\add when\add* thus he\f + \fr 127:2 \ft That is, Yahweh \f* provides\f + \fr 127:2 \ft Hebrew “gives” \f* for his beloved in \add his\add* sleep.\f + \fr 127:2 \ft Or “so he gives sleep to his beloved” \f*
Look, children\f + \fr 127:3 \ft Hebrew “sons” \f* \add are\add* the heritage\f + \fr 127:3 \ft That is, gift \f* of Yahweh;
the fruit of the womb \add is\add* a reward.
Like arrows in \add the\add* hand of a warrior,
so \add are\add* the children\f + \fr 127:4 \ft Hebrew “sons” \f* of \add one’s\add* youth.
Blessed \add is\add* the man who fills his quiver with them.\f + \fr 127:5 \ft Or “whose quiver he \fq Yahweh \ft fills with them” \f*
They shall not be put to shame
when they speak with enemies at the gate.
